title: 111_s1603
content: The Act titled "Veterans Education Tuition Support Act of 2009" or "VETS Act of 2009" provides tuition relief for postsecondary students called to military service. The VETS Act of 2009 offers tuition relief for students in higher education who need to withdraw due to military service, ensuring a refund of tuition and fees for the period without academic credit. The Act ensures a refund of tuition and fees for the period without academic credit, with exceptions for scholarships or funds awarded by the institution. Additionally, the Secretary can waive repayment amounts for students called to military service. The Secretary shall pay reimbursement for cancellation of Perkins loans. The Secretary will reimburse institutions for the cancellation of Perkins loans, deducting loans made from Federal capital contributions. No funds from section 461(b) will be used for these payments. The Secretary will pay qualifying institutions within 3 months of filing an application for campus-based funds. Any amounts returned, forgiven, or waived by the Secretary for students affected by withdrawal due to military service will not count towards the student's loan limits or affect eligibility for grants or loans. The amendments made by this Act will apply to periods of service in the uniformed services starting after the enactment date. The term "period of service in the uniformed services" is defined as the time from 30 days before reporting for service to the return from service.
